p: Workers should also be monitored for less common zoonotic diseases, some of which can be devastating to individual workers and specialised industries. In Australia, cases of the deadly Hendra virus (also known as equine morbillivirus) have, so far, been confined to equine handlers and veterinarians. Hendra virus is related to rabies and is spread by infected bat urine that contaminates pasture and stock feed. Horses are vulnerable to infection and it is easily passed from horse to handler. It is invariably fatal to both ( 35, 40).
